question: In which of the following circumstances, the prime minister of India cannot participate in voting on a no-confidence motion against his / her government?
option1: He / She leads a coalition government
option2: He / she has minority in Rajya Sabha
option3: He / she  is a member of Rajya Sabha
option4: He / she is forbidden by speaker of Lok Sabha
answer: He / she  is a member of Rajya Sabha
explanation: If PM is a member of Rajya Sabha, he can participate in procedures of both houses but can vote only in Rajya Sabha. Vote of No Confidence can be moved only in Lok Sabha so PM will not vote in it.
